help.commands:
Built-in Shell Commands:
  HELP            Show this help message
  EXIT, QUIT      Exit the interpreter
  CLEAR, CLS      Clear the screen
  HISTORY         Show command history
  VERSION         Show version information
  ABOUT           About PowerScript
help.syntax:
PowerScript Syntax:
  PRINT "text"                    Print output
  VAR name = value                 Declare variable
  VAR INT name = value             Declare typed variable
  NET.System.Console.WriteLine()  Call .NET methods
  EXECUTE "file.ps"                Execute script file
  FUNCTION name(params) { ... }    Define function
  RETURN expression                Return from function
help.examples:
Examples:
  PS> PRINT "Hello, World!"
  PS> VAR x = 10
  PS> VAR INT count = 5
  PS> NET.System.Console.WriteLine("From .NET!")
  PS> EXECUTE "myscript.ps"
  PS> FUNCTION ADD(INT a, INT b) { RETURN a + b }
help.about_content:
PowerScript is a .NET wrapper language with an interactive
interpreter shell. It provides direct access to the .NET
Framework through a simple, PowerShell-like syntax.

Key Features:
  â€¢ Direct .NET method invocation via NET. syntax
  â€¢ Function compilation to Lambda expressions
  â€¢ Script file execution and imports
  â€¢ Interactive REPL for rapid development
  â€¢ PowerShell-like command interface

Architecture:
  â€¢ Token-based lexical analysis
  â€¢ AST construction and traversal
  â€¢ Reflection-based .NET integration
  â€¢ Expression tree compilation
  â€¢ Persistent interpreter session
